alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 23 at 5:19PM MST until July 23 at 8:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 830 PM MST. * At 518 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near Sedona and north of Oak Creek. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sedona and Village At Oak Creek. This includes the following swimming holes... Grasshopper Point, Midgely Bridge, Buddha Beach "Red Rock Crossing" and Crescent Moon Ranch. This includes the following highways... State Route 89A between mile markers 371 and 379. State Route 179 between mile markers 302 and 313. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Oak Creek, Dry Creek, Dry Beaver Creek, Jacks Canyon and Rattlesnake Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
